title: New French government marks shift to the right
summary: The cabinet was appointed on Saturday evening 11 weeks after snap elections that saw a left-wing alliance come out on top but short of a majority in the Assemblée Nationale. Socialist party chairman Oliver Faure dismissed it as 'a reactionary government that gives democracy the finger.'

title: Intense Israeli strikes over southern Lebanon after deadly Beirut strike that killed at least 37
summary: On Saturday, the US urged American citizens to leave Lebanon while commercial options are available.

title: In China, the murder of a Japanese child heightens tensions between the two countries
summary: The 10-year-old boy was stabbed to death on Wednesday, September 18. It was the second such attack in a few months, at a time when China-Japan relations had deteriorated as a result of new Chinese military actions.

title: Far right wants to ban hiring a foreigner in case French candidate applies to same job
summary: To enforce the 'national preference' central to its program for decades, the far right wants to mandate the inclusion of nationality as a hiring criterion for all private sector jobs.

title: In Paris, shutters are at center of clash between heritage and climate adaptation
summary: Using external shutters is a simple and effective way of coping with heat waves. However, in the Paris region, the French national architectural advisory organization often refuse to allow them, in the name of heritage preservation.

title: Harris challenges Trump to CNN debate in October, Trump refuses
summary: The Democratic nominee's campaign said the vice president accepted a debate invitation from CNN for October 23. The Republican nominee says it's 'too late.'

title: European Heritage Days: 10 ideas for seaside visits
summary: The culture section of Le Monde offers a selection of sites highlighting maritime heritage. The 41st edition of the event takes place on Saturday and Sunday.

title: Understanding how the US presidential election works
summary: Before Tuesday, November 5, when polling stations open, several million Americans will have already cast their votes through mail-in ballots or early voting.

title: Lithuania's cultural season begins in France in the shadow of the war in Ukraine
summary: The diplomatic and cultural season opened on September 12, as the Baltic state fears the spread of the war to its territory.

title: Sri Lankan presidential election: Hope abounds for a new chapter after the 2022 revolution
summary: Two years after the popular movement that ousted President Rajapaksa, accused of turning South Asia's most developed country into a failed state, the country's citizens are set to elect a new leader on Saturday.

title: Presidential election in Venezuela: The Western dilemma
summary: Should opposition candidate Edmundo Gonzalez be considered the winner? While the European Parliament has adopted a resolution to this effect, neither the US nor the EU uses the term 'president-elect.'

title: Videos will not be broadcast 'systematically' at French mass rape trial
summary: Roger Arata, president of the criminal court, has decided to determine on a case-by-case basis whether or not to broadcast these images, 'with the sole aim of establishing the truth,' and to impose a closed session when the videos are shown.

title: Ukraine worries about the prospect of massive power cuts in the winter
summary: While Ukraine has continued to lose energy production capacity since the invasion began, power cuts could last between four to 18 hours a day, and even longer in the event of further Russian strikes on the country's infrastructure.

title: In Atlanta, Harris confirms how central reproductive rights are to her campaign
summary: The vice president spoke at length about the fate of a 28-year-old woman who died without medical care in Georgia after undergoing a pill-induced abortion.

title: Israeli strike in Beirut decimates command of Hezbollah's Radwan force
summary: Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant called the strike on Ibrahim Akil, the commander of this elite unit, a 'new phase of war.'

title: UK, US did not give go-ahead to use long-range missiles to hit inside Russia, Zelensky says
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned that firing long-range weapons into Russia would mean that NATO countries were at war with Moscow.

title: Gaza rescuers say at least 19 killed in strike on school-turned-shelter
summary: Gaza's civil defense agency said thousands of displaced people had sought shelter at the school in Gaza City. Israel's military said in a statement the air force had 'conducted a precise strike on terrorists who were operating inside a Hamas command.'

title: With 'No Name,' Jack White returns to his rock roots
summary: Secretly released this summer, the sixth solo album by the guitarist, singer and producer revives the White Stripes' galvanizing garage blues-punk.

title: Gaza's Health Ministry reveals names of several thousand dead, over 11,355 of them are minors
summary: Published on September 16, the 649-page document lists the deaths identified by the local Ministry of Health as of August 31, classified by age.

title: In Italy, Robby the cabby is driving for honesty
summary: Bologna cab driver Roberto Mantovani, aka 'Robby,' published a book over the summer denouncing the tax evasion practices of most of his colleagues. This transparency has earned him fame in his home country, but disdain among members of his profession.

title: The gastronomic temptations of Bordeaux châteaux
summary: The restaurant scene at Bordeaux châteaux is recent and growing. There are now around 20 restaurants with in-house chefs and views over the vineyards, unevenly distributed between the two banks of the Garonne river.

title: Israel raids Al Jazeera's West Bank bureau, orders 45-day closure
summary: Israel's government last week announced it was revoking the press credentials of Al Jazeera journalists in the country, four months after banning the channel from operating inside Israel.

title: French left unites against new government: 'We'll have to get rid of it as soon as possible,' warns Mélenchon
summary: A left-wing alliance, which came out on top in the July snap elections, was united in its criticism of Michel Barnier's very right-wing cabinet. But in the streets on Saturday, the mobilization against the government was weak.

title: Agnès Pannier-Runacher, a Macron veteran in charge of the environmental transition
summary: A member of the government since 2018, the former private-sector executive has survived every reshuffle.

title: How will French PM Michel Barnier play his environmental card?
summary: As environment minister in the 1990s, the current prime minister laid some of the foundations of France's environmental policy. A pioneer in his right-wing party regarding environmental issues, he then virtually stopped addressing them.

title: Le Monde's festival celebrates the paper's 80th anniversary with debates, concerts and more
summary: Le Monde is celebrating its 80th anniversary (and the 10th anniversary of the Le Monde festival!) from September 19 to 22, 2024.
